intro: Potentilla verna subsp. leucopolitana, commonly known as the white-flowered cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and have finely toothed margins. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands, meadows, and rocky areas.
